title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Friday, 20 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: two men are charged with killing a pizza delivery driver in peterborough .
the duke of cambridge interrupts a school sports day to help an injured woman .
st ives is revving-up for its first mobility scooter grand prix .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our coverage through the day
text: that 's it for this week , hope you have a great weekend .
join us again from 08:00 on monday for the latest news , sport , weather and travel for cambridgeshire .
until then you can get in touch with your or comments via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy this evening , with outbreaks of rain overnight
text: cloud will thicken overnight with outbreaks of rain which will be heavy in places later on .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
saturday will be cloudy and breezy with a few bright spells , though we are likely to see some rain later on which could turn heavy and thundery .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: four sentenced over migrant exploitation offences
text: four people have been jailed for offences relating to the exploitation of migrant workers in the fens .

juris valujevs , 37 , and oksana valujeva , 35 , of turbus road , king 's lynn ; lauma vankova , 27 , of creswell street , king 's lynn and ivars mezals ( below ) , 30 , of st bartholomew 's road , reading , were found guilty of conspiracy to acquire criminal property following a trial at huntingdon crown court in march .
vankova , valujeva and valujevs were also found guilty of assisting an immigration offence , which police say was connected to arranging sham marriages .
late this afternoon , at the same court , valujevs was jailed for a total of eight and a half years .
vankova and valujeva were each jailed for six years , and mezals was jailed for three years .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: punty mcbikeface ?
text: the university of cambridge suggests a good name for a pioneering new form of transport - effectively a bike-powered punt - is the puntcycle .
yawn .
someone responding on the university 's facebook page , where it posted a video of the contraption , suggested a better name would be punty mcbikeface - in homage to boaty mcboatface .
it 's better but has the joke ran its course now ?
anyhow , you can watch engineering student barnaby walk try out his invention on the river cam here .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridge mayor demands a u-turn on midsummer fair - causing split in labour ranks
text: cambridge 's mayor is demanding a rethink on plans to axe part of the city 's historic midsummer fair .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: man arrested after woman suffers life-threatening injuries in peterborough incident
text: a man has been arrested after an incident in peterborough which left a woman with life-threatening injuries .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: concern over missing student
text: police say they are growing increasingly concerned about a missing cambridge student .
matthew campsie , 21 , was last seen leaving fitzwilliam college at 07:30 .
dc clare havis , from the missing person investigation unit , said : `` we would urge anyone who has seen him , or may know where he is , to contact us immediately . ''
author: Julia Greenaway
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: on your bike : taking a punt on a new form of river transport in cambridge
text: cambridge is famous for bikes and punts - now engineering students have combined the two forms of transport .
the students @ twitterid have been working on a new breed of punt
he 's just ruined a way of life for many .
shoving a line stick in the ground is fun .
genius ! !
will we be seeing them on king 's parade ? ? ? ! !
well done one and all
excellent .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jamie oliver 's 'food revolution ' comes to peterborough
text: two chefs trained by jamie oliver are passing on their skills in peterborough today as part of the first food revolution day .
people who fancy learning a few `` pukka '' cooking tips can drop into peterborough city college today , where kevin earl and glenys armstrong are ready to share their secrets .
the celebrity chef told the bbc he 's looking to raise awareness of what he calls a global health crisis .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stressed-out students barking mad for puppy playtime
text: a puppy is a student 's best friend when it comes to dealing with exam stress at cambridge university .

this is the third year guide dogs uk has helped socialise puppies by taking them into the university , but says this time it has `` gone crazy '' - with over 25 requests from colleges to visit stressed-out students .
`` just stroking the puppies and watching them play takes their minds off all the studying they are doing - and the puppies love it too , '' volunteer puppy-walker gillian said .
author: Hannah Gelbart
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: police end search at mepal quarry following discovery of severed head
text: cambridgeshire police has told me officers have now left the quarry at mepal where a severed head was found on monday .
a spokesman said officers will still be in the vicinity of a construction site in sharnbrook , which has also been searched as part of the investigation .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prince william at controls of east anglian air ambulance
text: here 's the moment the east anglian air ambulance arrived on a school field in suffolk yesterday , piloted by the duke of cambridge .
prince william arrived at kingsfleet primary school at about 15:00 with a team of medics to treat a woman who hurt her leg nearby .
she was later taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .
her injuries were not life-threatening , the air ambulance said .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charges over pizza delivery driver death
text: two men from cambridgeshire and norfolk have been charged with killing a pizza delivery driver in peterborough .
ali qasemi ( 45 , was delivering food when he was attacked on shrewsbury avenue in the early hours of 8 may .
he died in hospital two days later .
mark lintott , 29 , of shrewsbury avenue , peterborough , and joel lawson , 25 , of goodhale road , norwich , were arrested and charged with manslaughter this morning .
they have also been charged with robbery , and mr lawson has been charged with possessing cannabis .
they are due to appear at peterborough magistrates ' court this afternoon .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: breakingtwo charged with manslaughter over pizza delivery driver death
text: police have just told us two men have been charged with killing a pizza delivery man in peterborough .
we 'll bring you more on this shortly .

documents.title: thumbs up to 'impeccably behaved ' children as prince william lands on school field to assist patient
text: sports day at kingsfleet primary school in felixstowe came to an abrupt end yesterday when the air ambulance landed on the school field - and the future king stepped off .
the duke of cambridge piloted the helicopter onto the field to assist a woman nearby who had injured her leg .
she was then taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge for treatment .
the school said pupils were gathered waiting for the sports day results when the ambulance landed .
`` all the children were impeccably behaved and very sensible , we are very proud of them , '' a statement on the school 's website said .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hare coursing spiralling 'out of all proportion ' , says farmer
text: a cambridgeshire farmer says hare coursing has spiralled , saying it 's `` gone bonkers , it 's got out of all proportion '' .
will wombwell , who farms in the south of the county , recently had his rammed by coursers trespassing on his land .
however , cambridgeshire police says reports of hare coursing are reducing after after a recent three-fold rise .
ch insp james sutherland says : `` last month alone we responded to 24 hare coursing incidents as a blue light job . ''
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: victims of former scout master 'showed tremendous courage '
text: the nspcc says the victims of john bates `` showed tremendous courage in reporting his hideous crimes to the police '' .
the former scout master , 68 , has been sentenced to 20 years in prison for sexually abusing boys when he was a scout leader in wittering and spalding .

a spokesman for the childrens ' charity said : `` we hope this case shows complaints will be taken seriously and that offenders can be held to account , no matter how privileged a position they held in society . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former scout master abused boys while serving in the raf at wittering
text: john bates abused two boys while he was a scout leader in wittering , where he was serving in the royal air force .
bates , 68 , who now lives in camden , north london , was found guilty by a jury at lincoln crown court of a number of sex attacks , including on boys while a scout leader in spalding .
judge simon hirst described bates as a predatory man who abused the enormous trust placed in him .
he 's been jailed for 20 years .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: breakingformer scout leader sentenced to 20 years for attacks on children
text: former police officer john bates who attacked two boys in the 1970s and '80s when he was a scout master in wittering has been jailed for 20 years .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: what happens during illegal hare coursing ?
text: farmers say hare coursing in the county is being streamed online , believed to be for gambling purposes .
here 's some facts about the illegal sport :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fresh calls to axe cambridge park and ride parking charges as journeys fall by 340,000 in a year
text: city deal bosses have vowed to find a way to scrap the `` foolish '' charges to park at cambridge 's park and ride sites , as the full scale of their impact emerged .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: st ives revving-up for mobility scooter grand prix
text: forget monaco or silverstone , fans of motor racing should head to st ives which is revving-up for its first mobility scooter grand prix .
the event is being held in the centre of the market town to raise money for the local shop mobility scheme , which lost council funding .

organiser john souter told bbc radio cambridgeshire drivers would be competing against the clock : `` sadly we wo n't be having a dozen mobility scooters racing at once - health and safety wo n't let us do it . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: st neots teenagers 'abuse ' over 'gender neutral ' surgery plans
text: a st neots teenager who is `` gender neutral '' says she has become a target for online abuse after going public about her plans to get surgery .
as reported in the cambridge news , opi baron is trying to raise £ 6,000 to pay for an extreme breast reduction .
the 19-year-old told bbc radio cambridgeshire since her story appeared in the press she has been told to kill herself .
`` they do n't see me as a person , just a thing for them to attack , '' she said .

documents.title: travel : two car crash on a15 in peterborough
text: the a15 london road in peterborough is partially blocked following a crash involving two cars .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: illegal hare coursing 'streamed online '
text: illegal hare coursing in the county is being streamed online , according to farmers .
a number have told bbc radio cambridgeshire offenders are doing it for betting purposes .
coursing involves driving onto fields and setting dogs - usually greyhounds , lurchers and salukis - after hares .
ch insp james sutherland said : `` there is an awful lot of gambling that goes on , but it 's all done undercover .
it 's all done in a very closed community . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : dry with bright or sunny spells today
text: after a cloudy start to the day , it will be fine and mostly dry with bright or sunny spells .
it will feel pleasantly warm in the sunshine .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
for more on what 's in store for where you live , go to bbc weather .
author: Aisling Creevey
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: thanks for joining us for friday 's cambridgeshire live
text: hello again , hope you 're well .
stay with us until 18:00 for the latest news , sport , weather and travel for cambridgeshire , including claims that illegal hare coursing in the county is being streamed on the internet .
and we 'll hear from a st neots woman who has been the target of online abuse after crowdfunding to pay for a breast reduction to make her `` gender neutral '' .
not long now to the weekend - we 'll find out what the weather 's got in store next .
remember , you can get in touch with your or comments via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
